lines.content: * A Deadline task is a simple task with a description and a deadline.
* Constructs a new Deadline task with the specified description and deadline.
* @param description The description of the Deadline task.
* @param by The deadline of the Deadline task.
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task.
* @return A string in the format "[D][statusIcon] description (by: date)".
* An Event task is a task with a description and a start and end timing.
* Constructs a new Event task with the specified description and timings.
* @param description The description of the Event task.
* @param from The start time of the Event task.
* @param to The end time of the Event task.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {

* @return A string in the format "[E][statusIcon] description (from: time to: time)".

* Marks a task as done based on the input index.
* @param input The input string containing the command and the task index.
System.out.println("    There's no such task yet!");
System.out.println("    Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
System.out.println("    Please input a valid task index!");
* Marks a task as not done based on the input index.
* @param input The input string containing the command and the task index.
System.out.println("    There's no such task yet!");
System.out.println("    OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
System.out.println("    Please input a valid task index!");
* Deletes a task based on the input index.
* @param input The input string containing the task index.

* Represents a task with a description and a status indicating whether it is done.

* @return "X" if the task is done, otherwise a space character.

* @return A string in the format "[statusIcon] description".
* A ToDo task is a simple task with only a description.
* Constructs a new ToDo task with the specified description.
* @param description The description of the ToDo task.
* Returns a string representation of the ToDo task.
* @return A string in the format "[T][statusIcon] description".
